channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In South Korea, insurrection charges are closing in on the president
item.description: Police, prosecutors and investigators have deemed President Yoon Suk Yeol as a suspect in a rare investigation into a sitting president for possible i...

item.title: Syria rebels burn tomb of Bashar al-Assad's father
item.description: Armed men are seen celebrating in Hafez al-Assad's burning mausoleum in the family's hometown.

item.title: French actor Adèle Haenel confronts director in sexual assault trial
item.description: The actor shouted "shut up!" at Christophe Ruggia before storming out court on the second day of the trial.

item.title: Atmospheric river brings weather whiplash to East Coast as bomb cyclone develops
Officials calling for more action, information on mysterious drones over New Jersey
item.description: The White House says the mysterious drones that have been spotted over New Jersey and parts of New York City are not foreign, but federal agents are i...

item.title: Clues to Luigi Mangione's ideology. And, courts halt Kroger and Albertsons megamerger
item.description: Murder suspect Luigi Mangione's digital footprint could provide clues to his ideology and possible motive. And, what's next for Kroger and Albertsons ...

item.title: Suicide bomb kills Taliban minister in Kabul
item.description: Khalil Haqqani is the Taliban's most high profile casualty since the group retook power in 2021.

item.title: Albertsons sues Kroger and ends failed grocery megamerger
item.description: The lawsuit over a deal to combine the two largest U.S. supermarkets came just a day after it was blocked in both federal and Washington state courts.

item.title: California child sickened after drinking raw milk
item.description: After drinking the unpasteurized raw milk, the child experienced fever and vomiting, local health officials said.

item.title: With Assad regime out, Syrians grapple with what comes next
item.description: Under Syria's president, a vast jail complex in the capital Damascus was known as a place where Syrians were disappeared without trial. Now it's crowd...

item.title: Nearly 200 people, mostly elderly, killed in gang-led massacre in Haiti
item.description: A gang-led massacre in Haiti has killed nearly 200 people, mostly elderly, as violence continues to grow in the country. Jacqueline Charles, Haiti and...

item.title: Malibu wildfire grows, thousands remain evacuated but firefighters will break from improving weather
Russian ships move from Syria base amid doubts over future
item.description: Satellite images show Russian ships off the Syrian coast, as Moscow mulls its military future after Bashar al-Assad's fall.

item.title: Luigi Mangione fingerprints match crime-scene prints - US media
item.description: The 26-year-old was arrested in Pennsylvania, and prosecutors are seeking to bring him to trial in New York.

item.title: Kimberly Guilfoyle is the latest Trump family ally chosen for an ambassadorship
item.description: Kimberly Guilfoyle, who got engaged to Trump's son in 2020, is the latest appointee he's chosen from his family tree. There's a long and controversial...

item.title: Police analyze fingerprint on cellphone as UnitedHealthcare CEO shooting suspect remains jailed
item.description: Authorities are analyzing a fingerprint on a cellphone found in their investigation into the man charged with killing UnitedHealthcare’s CEO.

item.title: Hegseth arrives on Capitol Hill for more meetings with senators, expresses confidence
item.description: Pete Hegseth, President-elect Donald Trump's pick for defense secretary, is back on Capitol Hill as he works to bolster support for Senate confirmatio...

item.title: Trump picks Kimberly Guilfoyle for ambassador to Greece
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has announced a number of new Cabinet picks and other appointments, including Kimberly Guilfoyle for ambassador to Greece...
